0.Summary: "swing shift management takes your life you live at McDonald's"
0.Pros: Advancement was fast and training was informative
0.Cons: Rude customers not organized no respect to eachother not really a welcoming environment

1.Cons: No benefits really, understaffed at times

3.Pros: Free food and drinks after hours

4.Pros: Okay wagesAlways busyCan be negotiated with pertaining to hours
4.Cons: It was so disorganized no one had a specific job. It was just whoever was there at the moment, that's the job they did. Everyone was always yelling and running around wildly.

5.Pros: A great way to put in part-time hours and get a bit of "spending cash" if you are a student, and don't mind having very few hours.
5.Cons: Very large team / selection of employees, lack of schedule consistency.

6.Summary: "Good place to pick up a few extra bucks."
6.Pros: You do get rewarded for hard work.
6.Cons: Not too many, it was mostly pretty good.

7.Summary: "Working At McDonalds Is What You Make Of It, If You Don't Want To Work Like A Robot This Is Not The Place For You."
7.Pros: Employee Discount, Good At Working Around School Schedule, Meet Great People Including Customers, Managers, and Coworkers, and Free Drinks On The Job.
7.Cons: Angry Customers, Lots Of Gossip Between Managers and Crew Members, Can Be Over Worked Sometimes, and Men Constantly Flirting With You.

8.Pros: Get better at talking to people.
8.Cons: No free lunches on break time

9.Pros: The airport location automatically offers above minimum wage as a instant bonus and the hours are pretty good.
9.Cons: The hours did not agree with my school schedule and I never made over $200 every two weeks.
